localize.title: The New York Times Trends
localize.description: See what's buzzing on The New York Times in your native language

nodes.title:
Within hours of Donald Trump announcing his new social media network, hackers gained access to a private version of the platform. The Anonymous-affiliated group posted images of defecating pigs, wrote expletive-laced rants and created fake accounts.
https://t.co/mXF84BXzNe
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Friends described Halyna Hutchins, who was killed when Alec Baldwin discharged a firearm being used as a prop, as someone whose talents had propelled her from Ukraine to success in Hollywood but who never forgot her home country. https://t.co/mCcgQO1yDf
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Breaking News: Pfizer said its vaccine was 90.7% effective in preventing symptomatic Covid in children ages 5 to 11, citing clinical trial data. The FDA is expected to release its own analysis of the data later on Friday.
https://t.co/PwdbazWJSb
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Alec Baldwin discharged a prop firearm on the set of "Rust," a Western he was making in New Mexico, killing the filmâ€™s director of photography and wounding the movieâ€™s director, the authorities said. https://t.co/iFRCvt6mUp
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
OnlyFans has a surprising new member: the Vienna Tourist Board.

The account will display artworks that other social platforms have censored. https://t.co/XNa1Ul0NX7
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: During the Mozambican Civil War from 1977 to 1992, humans killed so many elephants for their lucrative ivory that the animals seem to have evolved in the space of a generation. The result was that a large number are now naturally tuskless. https://t.co/RpMq8WN9tN https://t.co/uOK8pyowhp
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Buying a $1,000 iPhone can be equivalent to giving up $17,000 in retirement savings or 2,500 cups of coffee. Yet one in five people surveyed by WalletHub thought a new phone was worth going into debt for. https://t.co/YnM3J84NlA
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: President Biden said that he was open to ending the Senate filibuster so Democrats could pass voting rights legislation, raise the federal debt limit and possibly enact other parts of his agenda that had been blocked by Republicans. https://t.co/Tc2miH268q
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: The Federal Reserve announced sweeping new limits on trading by senior Fed officials after repeated criticism of its ethics rules. https://t.co/e3eLeGTml4
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Over the past decade, the waters around Cape Cod have become host to one of the densest seasonal concentrations of adult white sharks in the world. https://t.co/LcICQ7GEhk
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: During the Mozambican Civil War from 1977 to 1992, humans killed so many elephants for their lucrative ivory that the animals seem to have evolved in the space of a generation. The result was that a large number are now naturally tuskless. https://t.co/Q41vkiO27o
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Alec Baldwin fired a prop firearm while filming the movie "Rust" in New Mexico, killing a crew member and injuring the filmâ€™s director, the authorities said. https://t.co/65DyjQC63q
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: The House voted to find Steve Bannon in criminal contempt for stonewalling the Capitol riot inquiry. The Justice Department will decide whether to prosecute. https://t.co/79Tg6JB1Kv
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Dental records confirmed that the human remains found in a thickly wooded Florida park were those of Brian Laundrie, a â€œperson of interestâ€ in the murder of his fiancÃ©e, Gabrielle Petito, the FBI said on Thursday. 
https://t.co/wUQ7LH67AD
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Scientists now believe that a site known as Lâ€™Anse aux Meadows was inhabited by Vikings who came from Greenland. To this day, it remains the only conclusively identified Viking site in the Americas outside of Greenland. https://t.co/omri1Lx7At https://t.co/BnXo6xO2kn
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Will today be a bones day? ğŸ¦´ Millions of people are checking on Noodle, a TikTok-famous pug, every day to find out. https://t.co/obgP8nAzgC
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Organizers at Amazonâ€™s only fulfillment center in New York City are nearing enough signatures to file for a union election. If their request is validated, it could bring the second unionization vote at an Amazon warehouse in less than a year. https://t.co/PW18wWNoBV
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Five veterans tapped to advise Senator Kyrsten Sinema, an Arizona Democrat, resigned from their posts on Thursday, publicly accusing her of "hanging your constituents out to dry" and "answering to big donors rather than your own people." https://t.co/oSVqSoB72X
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
In Opinion

"Marriage as the prevailing ideal is losing its grip. And the stigma of being unmarried is also losing its grip, as it should. Now government policy that rewards the married while punishing the single must also loosen up," Charles Blow writes. https://t.co/JrgPlkPbBc
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Boston Celtics games were pulled from the Chinese internet after Enes Kanter, a center on the team, said on social media that Xi Jinping, China's leader, was a "brutal dictator." https://t.co/0QKKINfkBv
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
The U.S. government sold Wu-Tang Clanâ€™s one-of-a-kind album "Once Upon a Time in Shaolin" to satisfy a judgment against its first owner, Martin Shkreli.

Now we know who bought it. https://t.co/jl8XE1Igjf
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Amid cheers and chants of â€œTeam trans!,â€ dozens of Netflix employees walked out of a Los Angeles office building, protesting Dave Chappelle's stand-up special. In addition, many staffers working remotely called off work for the day at noon. https://t.co/DtoyDxEnzZ https://t.co/QzsYmoZl5t
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Dozens of Netflix employees walked out of a Los Angeles office building on Wednesday, protesting Dave Chappelle's recent stand-up special. They carried signs that read "Team Trans" and "Transphobia Is Not a Joke."  https://t.co/5YTYK93dGl
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: New York City will require all city workers to be vaccinated by the end of October or lose their paychecks. City employees will no longer be allowed to submit to regular testing as an alternative. https://t.co/FoyCgY2AiY https://t.co/99RknRhnjv
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Mayor Bill de Blasio said 46,000 unvaccinated New York City workers must get a coronavirus shot by November or lose their paychecks. Regular testing will not be an option for workers who refuse to get vaccinated, he said. https://t.co/lsYdEH4uJV
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Nadia Chaudhri was a neuroscientist with terminal ovarian cancer who used her final months to raise money for graduate students of diverse backgrounds and to educate the public about her disease. She has died at age 43. https://t.co/tedGqj0TVP
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Human remains were found in a Florida wildlife reserve on Wednesday, near items belonging to Brian Laundrie, who has been declared a "person of interest" in the murder of his fiancÃ©e, Gabrielle Petito, the FBI said. https://t.co/VwBgnOvbJ7
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: The FDA authorized Moderna and Johnson & Johnson for booster shots, and allowed the mixing and matching of different types of Covid vaccines. https://t.co/TDnHmi08Uw
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Amherst College announced on Wednesday that it would end legacy admissions, becoming one of the first highly selective colleges in the U.S. to abandon a practice that has been a persistent barrier to increasing student diversity. https://t.co/UHHRWGocaZ
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: In the spring of 2020, Donald Trumpâ€™s â€‹defense secretary quashed a proposal to send up to 250,000 U.S. troops to seal the border with Mexico. Top national security aides also talked Trump out of launching military raids against drug cartels inside Mexico. https://t.co/Yc8q23Y6eN
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A man said he asked two police officers to wear masks in accordance with MTA and New York City Police Department policy before he was eventually pushed out of the station. â€œIf youâ€™re not going to ride the train, just get out,â€ he said an officer told him. https://t.co/B6C8zdF5N8
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: "It was the first time the Atlantic Ocean was crossed." Scientists say they have pinned down a precise year that Norse explorers from Europe were on land that came to be Newfoundland â€” the year A.D. 1021, or exactly 1,000 years ago. https://t.co/w5b4Bs7KDx
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
The movie theater chain AMC will offer open captions, which are displayed on screen in a way similar to subtitles, at 240 locations in the U.S.

The move was praised by advocates for the deaf and the hard of hearing, who have long sought better captioning.
https://t.co/eH2z4VXz0t
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: New York City will require all city workers to be vaccinated by the end of the month or lose their paychecks, a new mandate for the largest municipal work force in the U.S., Mayor Bill de Blasio said. https://t.co/9fI9W9M0in https://t.co/P9e2bkGZqi
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Senate Republicans were expected again to block action on voting rights legislation. Lawmakers and activists are becoming increasingly alarmed that the proposed legislation will stall and put Democrats at a disadvantage in coming elections. https://t.co/EOywTMPMUt
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: In a first, a kidney grown in a genetically altered pig was found to work normally after it was attached to a human patient. https://t.co/EjjQOknyEQ https://t.co/n2zzW3ejjZ
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Aleksei Navalny, the imprisoned Russian opposition leader, was awarded the EUâ€™s top human rights award.

â€œTodayâ€™s prize recognizes his immense bravery and we reiterate our call for his immediate release,â€ the president of the European Parliament said.
https://t.co/tuA5r1imGs
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Breaking News: New York City will require all city workers to be vaccinated against the coronavirus or risk losing their jobs, Mayor Bill de Blasio said. Regular testing will not be an option for workers who refuse to get vaccinated, he said.
https://t.co/zMyAjI4ZXI
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Mark Zuckerberg will be added to a data privacy lawsuit in one of the first efforts by a regulator to expose him personally to potential penalties.
https://t.co/0r0Wj5wBxH
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil should face homicide charges over his mishandling of the pandemic, a report by a panel of Brazilian senators said, asserting that his policies intentionally let the virus kill hundreds of thousands of people in Brazil. https://t.co/rQhHATHwmW https://t.co/UTzlE7ppZy
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Neil Cavuto, a Fox News anchor, has tested positive for the coronavirus. â€œHad I not been vaccinated, and with all my medical issues, this would be a far more dire situation,â€ he said. https://t.co/5CgkYDkizZ
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: A House panel recommended charging Steve Bannon with contempt for refusing to comply with a subpoena in the Capitol riot inquiry. The House is expected to approve the move and hand the matter over to the Justice Department for prosecution. https://t.co/V3cPn11NCa
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: In a first, a kidney grown in a genetically altered pig was found to work normally after it was attached to a human patient. https://t.co/WJawx4qTJy
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Dr. Rachel Levine was sworn in as  the first female four-star admiral in the history of the U.S. Public Health Service Commissioned Corps, a uniformed service of more than 6,000 health, science and engineering professionals.
https://t.co/vR69Ae18qB https://t.co/94phwg83KO
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Democrats agreed to scale back a plan for the IRS to try to crack down on tax cheats, bowing to an aggressive lobbying campaign by the banking industry and pushback from Republicans. https://t.co/owwTEod1kM
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A 900-year-old sword that a scuba diver found off the Carmel coast of Israel weighs four pounds, measures about four feet long and originated from the Third Crusade, experts said. https://t.co/HYBh222kGf https://t.co/lxoXfF4jsl
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: President Jair Bolsonaro of Brazil should face homicide charges over his mishandling of the pandemic, a Brazilian Senate report said, asserting that his policies intentionally let the virus kill hundreds of thousands of people in Brazil. https://t.co/E9M07K75wK
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine was 93% effective against hospitalization with Covid-19 among 12- to 18-year-olds, the CDC reported on Tuesday. https://t.co/dWZLQr1ezI
nodes.author: The New York Times

https://t.co/doVW3UpLCe
